thread.title: Sears, Kmart dump Trump home products from online stores
thread.title_full: Sears, Kmart dump Trump home products from online stores

author: ELIZABETH ELIZALDE
title: Sears, Kmart dump Trump home products from online stores
text:
Sears, Kmart dump Trump home products from online stores amid boycotting movement Sears, Kmart dump Trump home products from online stores The decision comes after other major U.S. retailers parted ways with the Trump brand. (Steven Senne/AP) NEW YORK DAILY NEWS   8:29 PM 
Major U.S. department retailers Sears and Kmart removed 31 Trump Home products from their online stores, a spokesman said. 
"As part of the company’s initiative to optimize its online product assortment, we constantly refine that assortment to focus on our most profitable items," Sears Holdings Corporation spokesman Brian Hanover told Reuters in a statement, adding that neither Sears nor Kmart carries Trump Home products in-house. 
The Trump Home collection, which is owned by the Trump Organization, includes furniture, bedding, lighting, mirrors and chandeliers, according to its website . President Trump, accompanied by his daughter Ivanka, defended her on Twitter after Nordstrom decided to part ways with the Trump brand. (Evan Vucci/AP) 
Neither Sears Holdings Corporation — which oversees Kmart — nor the Trump Organization immediately responded to requests for comment. 
The decision comes after Nordstrom decided to part ways with Ivanka Trump’s line due in part because of declining sales, prompting President Trump to say on Twitter that his daughter has been “ treated so unfairly .” A Sears spokesman said the company stopped selling Trump Home items on its online stores. (Tim Boyle/Getty Images) 
Nordstrom sales of Ivanka’s line “fell by nearly one-third in the past fiscal year, with sharp drops in sales weeks before her father Donald Trump was elected president,” the Wall Street Journal reported Saturday. 
Nieman Marcus dropped Trump’s jewelry line last weekend. TJ Maxx and Marshalls have also distanced themselves from the Trump brand amid a growing #GrabYourWallet campaign urging customers to boycott the Trump brand. Ivanka Trump’s brand high heels are on sale in the clearance section at a Century 21 department store. (Drew Angerer/Getty Images) 
Kellyanne Conway urges people to ‘go buy Ivanka’s stuff’ 
Kellyanne Conway, counselor to the President, was also quick to defend Ivanka on "Fox & Friends," telling the public to buy her product in what she called a “free commercial.” 
Rep. Elijah Cummings (D-M.D.) and House Committee Oversite Chair Jason Chaffetz co-wrote a letter to the Office of Government Ethics Thursday, requesting the agency investigate Conway's comments. Join the Conversation:
